Then he she has to send that document to the school management where they will check for the validity of the document
If the document is not valid the process comes to an end and the excursion will not take place
If the document is valid the school management has to decide if they want to let the teacher carry out the excursion or not
If they decide to not give the permission to execute the excursion the process comes to an end
If they decide to let the teacher do the excursion they have to sign the document and send it to the accountant
The accountant will then evaluate the price of the excursion and he she will inform the teacher
The teacher will then inform the parents of the excursion and give them all the necessary information such as the location the price the date and some general information about it
After that the teacher has to wait for the parents decision to either let go or not their child on the excursion
Once the teacher has received the parents decision he she will book the excursion and carry it out
Once the excursion is done the teacher has to complete the rest of the excursion document and to send it to the accountant

The accountant will then complete the document with other necessary documents such as the invoice and he she will also mention the fees of the excursion in the periodic settlement of the students so that the fees will be added to what the parents have to pay at the end of the period
After that the document is archived and the process is completed
Because of the covid crisis Sainte Vronique had to modify their organisation of parents meeting process
Indeed parents cannot enter the school anymore
The school tried the new process out in June last year and they improved it for this year
The process starts when report cards are encoded in the specific software used by the school
The student s report is then received by his or her parents
In the report card there is a comment section in which parents can find the teachers the school wants them to meet
An online form is created on the LMS and sent to the parents for each year

The questions are the following first name and last name of the student class name of the person filling the form phone number of this person a multiple choice question with three time intervals and who are the three teachers the parents want to meet
Once the due date to fill in the form is reached the form is closed by the IT manager
The form is exported in an Excel format and the table is shared with the teachers on the LMS
The table is posted on the right year group
Teachers can download the document and check whether the parents who were asked to meet them are on the list
If they are not on the list the teacher has to add them
Once it is done the teacher can schedule the phone calls
If needed the school can provide some phones and a room for teachers to call the parents
If during the parents meeting the teachers notices an exceptional situation he or she has to notify the school management
The school management will then handle the case depending on the situation
Every new year Collge Sainte Vronique opens its enrolment process which consists of registering first year students for the following academic year
Before entering the heart of the process the school has to achieve some optional or mandatory activities in order to prepare the enrolment period
The mandatory one is to communicate the school capacity for first year students as well as the number of classes in the different sections general path immersion path
For the optional ones on the one hand they have the possibility to enter into partnerships with other institutions to facilitate the movement of students from one school to another
On the other hand a first contact may be organized
Then from February 10 th the first enrollment phase starts and pupils can hand over their application form to the school
Of course the school must check if the application form is correct and well filled
If it is not the case the application is refused and cancelled
Next we need to distinguish the first and the second enrolment phase because applications will not be handled in the same way
Registration requests must therefore be allocated to the period corresponding to them
The first phase begins on February 10 and ends on March 7 while the second phase is opened from April 27 to August 24
First registration phase Each application for registration must first be registered and then updated in the register which in most cases takes the form of a database
In each application form there are two sections that have to be completed by parents
The general part has to be hand written but for the confidential part parents have the choice to fill it online or in paper format
If the parents choose the paper format the school is responsible for mailing the confidential section to CIRI
Otherwise with the online form the form is directly transmitted to CIRI
Finally the school sends a confirmation mail to say that the application has been handled correctly
Once March 7 is reached the school closes the first registration phase
If there are more registrations than available places pupils will be ranked according to different criteria by CIRI
The ranking is used to attribute places to top ranked pupils
The ranking and the result of the selection has to be sent to the pupil and parents
If the pupil has been selected a registration certificate is created
Else the pupil is put on the waiting list
If there were not more registrations than available places a registration certificate is immediately created
Second registration phase As for the first phase the school has to register each application and update the register book
However it is not necessary to send the confidential section to CIRI because this part is used to make the ranking
After that either the school is already complete and the pupil has to be put on the waiting list or there are still places left and a registration certificate can be immediately created for the pupil
A student in phase 2 will not be given priority over a student in phase 1 in the waiting list
From now the two phases can be gathered in one common path
On the side of students who received a certificate of registration the school has to request that the pupil provides his CEB
If the CEB is received before September 1 the process carries on
Else the application will be rejected and a certified refusal letter with return receipt requested will be sent
Then at the start of the school year attendance will be taken and if the pupil is not present he will have to justify his non attendance within 8 days otherwise he will be expelled
On the side of students who are on the waiting list they have to wait until a place becomes available
If it is the case the school will inform the pupil of the situation and will ask him whether he wants to take the place or not
If so then a registration certificate will be written and the process will follow the normal path described earlier
If the student refuses the place then his application will be cancelled
A student on the waiting list can also cancel his or her application by sending a message to the school
And lastly the waiting list is closed on August 24 which means that all students still on it will receive a certificate of refusal
The recruitment is dealt with by the administrator Pierre Girretz himself
Indeed as mentioned before the company does not have an HR department nor a true recruitment system established since the administrator can easily do this type of work himself
This process is triggered only when a new post is available and it is done in a more or less informal but also classical way he receives applications and reads the CVs then Mr
Girretz first checks if the applicant has the competencies required for the job degree experience
If the resume does not correspond to what is expected then the application is rejected by email with a thank you for sending the CV
If the candidate seems to have the right competencies on paper then he receives a notification to fix a date for an interview
Right after the interview the administrator evaluates the candidate on his personality
Indeed Mr Girretz puts a lot of importance on his gut feeling

So if the personality matches then the candidate is given a trial period to see the quality of his work see if he can work with the team and to check if the person understands what the company needs and if he will be involved in the future
If the candidate does not fulfill these characteristics then his application is rejected after the trial period

Otherwise if the administrator is happy with his work he scans the person s ID and bank cards and they both sign the hiring document given by Securex and finally the applicant is officially hired after declaring the recruitment to the Dimona
This process consists of the reception of the different supplies needed to build the pellet stoves
First the supplier receives a notification with the item Sti needs then they prepare the order and notifies the company when it is ready to be sent
When the items are received the head of the production checks their quality by following the production quality sheet s instructions and ticks the boxes corresponding
If their quality is ok then the item s QR codes are scanned to be registered on the system and then each item is placed at the post where it will be needed to build the stoves
In other words the head of the production paves the way for the order preparation process
However if the items are defective then a letter is written to explain the problem to the supplier and the supplies are sent back to receive better ones
When a client wants to buy a stove he needs to request a quote on Sti s website and to choose from a list of characteristics his dream pellet stove
Then when the company receives it assuming every item is in stock the order preparation process can begin

Employees working in the production line start by identifying the type of stove the client wishes to order they write down the model the power of the stove optional features and they also transfer the quote to the reseller since he will be the one in charge of providing the final product to the customer
After that the production line checks if the items needed for assembly are in stock
If not an order request is sent to the supplier to receive the missing supplies
When every item is in stock employees search for pieces emplacement in the system thanks to the QR code they scanned when they first received the items
Then the actual assembly can start the goods go from post to post the stove is built little by little at every step
Once it reaches post number N the number of posts depending on each case the final product is fully built and is ready to go through a quality check
Once this quality check process is done the pellet stove is packaged in a plastic cover and a wood box
Finally it can be shipped to the reseller store which will be in charge of selling the stove to the customer
This process is basically about testing the stove from A to Z looking for leaks checking for malfunctions and so on
The quality check is once again done in the production line
The process starts when a stove is done being assembled and ends when it is operational and can be sent to the reseller
In the first step the employees fill in the production quality sheet by first writing down the stove s info like the guaranteed number the model its options the customer s details and so on
Next the stove s components are checked and tested by following the sheet s instructions
They then turn the engine on to check it works perfectly and that there is no leak or any other problem as said previously
If there is an issue then workers use the QR code system we talked about earlier to find which pieces are missing or misplaced in the stove and fix them
When they are sure the stove is working well they can start to suck potential dirt and clean the whole stove
Once both are done they stick an A++ label and a CE European Conformity label on the door of the engine
After that the rest of the quality sheet has to be filled up
Then an instruction sheet a plan of the stove and a list of the items are added to the packaging of the pellet stove
In the end the product is fully operational and is ready to leave the company
The after sales process begins when a client needs professional intervention
When the client wishes to do its stove s annual maintenance a qualified operator is sent to its home
In that case it is not Sti who is responsible for that operation but the stoves reseller store depending on the localization stores in Belgium France Switzerland

So Sti s employees will not take care of the maintenance but rather an external professional who has conducted one of Sti s training or a mechanic who has Sti s approval to operate on its stoves will do it
If the client needs an intervention because its stove has a technical problem then it contacts Sti
The administrator the chief technician and the head of the production can all take care of the process indifferently

When the company is notified it then fills in the after sales form by between others selecting the stove type and its features the MAC   IP addresses of the stove the type of service it needs and by writing the customer s and the reseller s contact information
If the stove needs a physical intervention because it cannot be dealt with remotely then the problem is handed over to MILLE Services a subsidiary company
After receiving information on the problem this company will then send one of its technicians to repair the stove then the after sales form will be signed by both the customer and MILLE Services
Otherwise if physical intervention is not necessary which is mostly the case then Sti will solve the problem remotely through the internet thanks to the app it recently developed

So first they will use this app to detect the problem on the stove then they will change the engine s parameters through the remote control system and will fill in the sheet with every problem encountered while doing so
When they are done they check if the stove is operational
If so the after sales document is signed and the process is over
If not then the stove will need a supplementary intervention physically thus Sti contacts MILLE Services and the service is handed to them as stated previously
This process begins with the registration of the quotation
When the welder load is planned he will assign a design engineer to the project
First of all the planner will plan the welder load
After that several things will be made simultaneously
On the one hand the quality manager will design the quality plan
On the other hand the design engineer will first analyze the file in order to be able to draw the nomenclature of the project
After that the welding engineer will give the soudage instructions
Then the process will continue with the calculation engineer who will make the calculation
When these two simultaneous parts of the process will be covered the pawn can move on to the resolution of questions task executed by the design engineer
When all the questions will be covered it is the task of the project manager to validate the project
Now it will be up to the client to look at the drawing to approbate it in order to launch the creation of the project
If the customer has other questions he will send an email to the company to disapprove the drawing
The design engineer will be obliged to do the task of questions resolution again
If the customer approves the drawing the company will receive an email from him
After having received the customer approbation the company will purchase its raw materials
The project will then be sent to the workshop
Two sub processes will then be required simultaneously
The production traceability and the inspection
After that the calculation note will be drafted by the calculation engineer and the welding book by the welding engineer
The plan as built will then be drawn
The process ends with the expedition
It is important to know that Into this process each thing that will be associated with creation or assignment will be included in the ERP in the file created in the quotation registration
The process begins when the purchasing department receives a purchase need
They will first analyze the request
Then they will check if an authorized provider exists
In fact they must have to work with suppliers accepted by Ortmans in order to be certain of the quality of the service
If a valid supplier exists for the requirement then we send him a request for quotation If this is not the case the quality assurance manager will seek out a new supplier and evaluate it
Once this is done we can send the request for a quote
When the purchasing department receives the quote it is analyzed and then an order is sent to the supplier
Once the order is received by the storekeeper he will check the quantity received via the shipping document
If a control card exists then a quality controller must inspect the delivery qualitatively
Then the conformity is checked via the ERP by the storekeeper
If the order is compliant then it synchronizes the receipt of the order in the ERP and the purchase is complete
If the order is non compliant then the quality assurance manager will initiate a process to manage non compliance
Once this is completed the storekeeper can synchronize the receipt of the order in the ERP and the purchase will be completed
At another time the billing department will receive the invoice of the order which will start their process
This will be checked in the ERP
Once the service is notified that the receipt of the order has been synchronized in the ERP it can proceed to the payment and the payment will be completed
The improvement action process starts with an improvement demand based on different sources internal or external audit report management review customer complaint non compliance suggestion etc
The request is then registered in the Excel table by the Quality Assurance Manager Q A M
This excel file will be used all along the process
It is important to detect the issue which means that an analysis of the problem in order to know the ins and outs of each approach will be conducted by the Q A M
Then the Q A M will conduct a criticality analysis in order to put the necessary resources on the actions that require it
A corresponding amelioration file will be created in the excel table
It will help in the choice of whether or not to initiate an improvement action
When the amelioration file is finished the Q A M will be able to analyse the issue properly
If there is no improvement needed the Q A M will answer to the improvement demand applicant with if possible an explanation for the refusal
However if an improvement is needed the Q A M will determine the action with a reasonable timeframe and a person responsible for the action
Those elements will also be added to the excel file
When the action and those who are in charge of it are defined the Q A M will inform the direction
When the direction is informed of the issue she provides the necessary means and then launches the action
The Implementation of the improvement action is then carried out by the action responsible
In parallel the Q A M follows up this implementation of the improvement action
When the improvement action is finished the Q A M checks the effectiveness of the action implemented i e checking that the action focuses on the causes and not only on the consequences
If the result is satisfying the improvement action process ends there
Otherwise the criticality analysis must be reseen and the process starts again from this point
The process starts when an unconformity is detected
A non conformity must be declared when one or more of the following conditions are met
Immediate repair at no significant cost is not possible
Immediate repair at low cost is possible but the problem is recurrent
Immediate low cost repair is possible but can lead to an opportunity for improvement
Supplier defect which includes not only raw material suppliers but also service providers and subcontractors
Customer complaint is the subject of a complaint and therefore a complaint sheet is completed and if necessary a non conformity sheet is completed
The initials of the initiator with the date are added on the sticker who must be created to mark the non conformity
Next they have to fill in the non conformity sheets so that they do not have to search for information that is known to the initiator
The NCS is transmitted to the QAM who is responsible for its follow up
Record in Excel file for follow up
The QAM communicates the NCS to the PM Project manager
The person who is responsible for the non compliance is the quality manager
This is the quality manager who makes a proposal for action at the project manager
It is the PM who makes the decision whether or not to accept this proposal for action
If the answer is no the quality manager must make another proposal for action
If it is approved the project manager notifies the client and waits to receive the formal acceptance of the client
If the client doesn t accept it is up to the quality manager to remake another proposal action
Both QAM and the quality manager must decide for verifications to do if the client accepts the proposal action
Now it is up to the quality manager to make improvement actions and verify these actions back
He will close the NCS remove the marking non conformity and notify the QAM who shall verify the process make analysis
After the analysis if he decides that other improvement actions must be taken they will make a new one
If not they will archive the non conformity
The process starts when a client needs new equipment and asks the company for a quotation
The project manager receives the request and analyzes it in terms of solvency of the client and in terms of capacity of the company to produce the client s equipment
An acknowledgment of receipt is sent to the client
The project manager asks the management for an approval and depending what the management will decide the client s request will be approved or not
If the request is rejected the project manager will send a rejection to the client otherwise the process continues and the project s file is created with an ERP s number
Then the design office makes an analysis of the different technical aspects and a quotation request is sent to the supplier
Finally with all the information received the project manager makes the quote and then asks the management for some advice about the quote
Afterward the project manager establishes the offer which is registered in the ERP and sends it to the client
If the client accepts the offer the project manager receives the order form
The order form is registered in the ERP system and a confirmation is sent to the client
The contract is reviewed by the project manager the file is prepared and information is sent for the registration to delivery process and the quotation registration process is ended
This process happens repeatedly throughout the day to journalists
Indeed they have to write several articles for the next day s daily journal

The main subject of an article usually comes from an informant with a scoop last minute information or from requests for coverage or news they received for example through the alert us button of their website
Daily news and important events have priority over more common subjects
Therefore if crucial information is given by someone with a high position or an informant to a journalist he must not hesitate to dive in and collect more information about it
Once the subject is received or chosen the first step is confirming the information with a reliable person
We will consider Lige s Christmas market cancellation as an example
The journalist obtaining this information then has to ask Lige s mayor to confirm it
However if the information comes from the alert us button the journalist will set up a meeting with the person in order to further analyze it
A subject with incoherent or false information will be rejected whereas the process will continue for a reliable and true subject
If a journalist were to obtain crucial information it must be published even partially as soon as possible so that it is not stolen from the competition
Thus it is directly posted on Sudpresse s paying website
On the contrary if the information can wait the journalist should collect more details about it
Once it is done the journalist makes a synthesis of the information he has received to this point to know what he should search next
In both cases phone calls emails and internet researches will follow in order to complete and detail the current subject
The information research process ends as soon as the journalist has gathered enough detailed information to write the article
The journalist is responsible for this process from its start to its end
Sometimes as demonstrated in the previous process information must be revealed without delay to readers with a subscription
That is why the information written as quickly as possible will be briefly explained on Sudpresse s paying website
Following this event a strategic marketing employee in the newsroom creates a teasing placed on the free website
This teasing includes a link to the company s paying website
Afterwards the journalist will progressively continue filling out the online article on the paying website adding information and upgrading the layout until it is complete and perfect
The journalist contacts his sources to find new he can add to his article
If he gets new information from a tier he contacts this tier that becomes thus one of a source or any other source who can verify clarify this new information
The last version of the online article will be published the next morning in the traditional newspaper
Compared to a few years ago journalists do not write complete articles that only come out the following day as they first have to post them online
This applies to any level of importance of the information

Then once the article has been completed and is published on the different websites and when due to the tight timing the article must be finished to be in the next day s newspaper the journalist asks for a page of the next day s daily journal and starts copying the article s content

Before every publication digital or paper the articles are corrected by a spelling software a first time and a second time by a professional reviewer whose job is to avoid mistakes in the spelling and to ensure an optimal layout for the article
Once the page for the daily newspaper is finished it is sent to the rotary press in Nivelles
This concludes the article writing and publishing process
As soon as the pages from the different upcoming newspapers are received the printing process begins at the Nivelles printing
First relief plates are made for every single page of each newspaper
Then these plates are put four by four on the rotary press
Once this step is operated the rotary press is switched on
Then plates go in the four primary colors and the newspapers pages are printed
At this stage a mechanical system allows to assemble pages with one another fold and bind them to form the newspaper
The newspapers are then automatically packaged and are ready to be shipped
During the whole work of the machine printing assembling the work of the employee is simply reduced to monitor the machine
The supply process of daily newspapers is critical and is obviously relying on the nature of past processes
Any delay can be toxic for the supply process and could cause terrible financial losses for Sudpresse and for booksellers themselves
First we will focus on individual newspaper delivery
Newspapers must be ready for delivery at 01 00 a m they are put into trucks and taken to the sorting office in Brussels
They are then charged 30 minutes before the departure into night trains taking them to the cities where the different sorting centers are located
Once the newspapers are in those centers vans are used to deliver them to the local post offices
The postmen then deliver the newspapers in individual mailboxes
This must take place before 7 30am as it is essential that a good part of workers have enough time to read their newspaper before going to work
We will now focus on bookshops delivery
Instead of going to the Sorting post office in Brussels trucks go straight to regional private delivery centers
Newspapers are then sorted and dispatched in vans that deliver over four thousand bookshops all over Belgium
This type of delivery should take place even earlier than the individual deliveries 7am at the latest as bookshops make half of their daily sales before 9 am
Through this process description we realize that timing is essential in the press sector
Nowadays writing and creating new articles does not suffice to create enough value for multimedia companies
Therefore various advertising processes are in constant change in the press industry and are therefore impossible to describe entirely
Nevertheless thanks to the two interviews we have conducted with our contacts at Sudpresse we were able to identify some crucial steps in these processes

We established earlier that there is a market department running many analyses in order to determine what are the best advertising spots on the website which format which size which colors which position on the page etc
The IT department will then determine who sees what advert and most importantly these people s background and profile by using big data
Once the advertising spots have been defined it is time for the sales department to intervene
Using the data previously collected sales teams have to sell these spots to advertisers
Advertisers have many options
On the newspaper they can choose to advertise on a quarter of a page half a page or an entire page knowing that each of these options has a different cost and impact on the reader
Different spots can be chosen on the website
One option of advertising on the website is through storytelling which has been a growing tendency in the previous years
In this case advertising is made through an interview of a representative of the concerned company ending with a link to the company s website
The interview is in this case realized after the writing of the contract
An advertisement may appear one or multiple times depending on the agreement that has been made between the sales teams and the advertiser
Once the advertiser has decided what he wishes to do a contract is written by the sales department of Sudpresse
When it is done the contract is sent to the advertiser
The contract is often approved by the advertisers
If it is not the contract is reviewed
A contract is never abandoned because if a contract has been written it is because there is a demand from an advertiser
The advert is then created and published in the chosen canals with a determined frequency and time frame
The catering process starts when a customer calls a Poivre Sel point of sale for its services
One of the employees answers the phone call and asks automatically for the date and the number and variety of products wanted
The employee then asks for the customer s usual point of sale
If the client doesn t call his her usual point of sale the employee has to conduct the customer to the usual one and the order is sent there
If the client is a new or a usual one 10 the employee then asks for the address
Afterwards he checks the availability of the employees on this date and this address
If none of the employees is available the process ends
Otherwise the employee answering the call determines the type category of the client and as a result of this proposes a series of products specific to the client
It is then the job of the franchisor CEO to emit the invoice to the client
He receives the payment and checks if there is any missing information
If information is missing he sends a formal notice to the customer with the ERP system of Poivre Sel Teamleader
The franchisor receives the missing information and if it is still missing the purchase order is rejected
When the payment is completed the employees can start the order
They deliver the order at the social event and the purchase order is completed
The franchising process is quite simple
Anyone interested in becoming a franchisee can obtain information at a point of sale or and on the website
He then contacts Mr Buche to ask him if he can become a franchisee
Then Mr Buche will meet with the interested party to explain the principle of his company and its history
After this discussion he asks the franchisee if he is still interested
The franchisee will then give an answer to the franchisor
If he decides to continue then Mr Buche will take him on a day long immersion trip to his point of sale in order to learn more about the franchisee and to show him how a day in a point of sale goes
After that day both parties take a week to think about whether or not they want to continue
The decision comes from both parties
If they continue the prospective franchisee must sign a confidentiality document
Once this is done the franchisee starts looking for a location for their new outlet
Once he has found it he will show it to Mr Buche so that he can take care of the market research and a cost benefit calculation to see if the location is ideal and profitable
If it is not the franchisee has to look for another location
If it is the calculations are sent to the franchisee s accountant for validation
Once validated it takes a few months for the fieldworks to be completed and then the franchisee pays Mr Buche for the fieldworks
The franchisee can then finally open his point of sale
The franchisee receives the calendar of meetings for the year
One of the franchisees has a new recipe idea
He waits for the next meeting to propose it
Then we see if the idea is appreciated if not we stop
If it is appreciated the franchisee who had the idea suggests to make a vote
The vote is made with all the franchisees and the franchisor by raising their hand
If the majority raises their hands we make the recipe if not the requested is rejected
A customer arrives in front of the cashier at Poivre Sel to eat
First of all the cashier asks him whether he is eating on the spot or to take away
If the customer eats on the spot the waiter makes him sit down and asks the customer what he wants to eat
Once the order is taken the waiter gives the order to the cook who prepares it and gives it back to the waiter once it is ready
The waiter then takes the dish back and serves it to the customer
Then the waiter waits until the customer s meal is over i e when the customer calls the waiter
The waiter will then send him the invoice and receive payment from the customer and then hand over the money received at the cash desk
If the customer has taken out the cashier asks the customer for the order
Then gives the order to the cook who prepares it and returns it to the cashier once the preparation is finished
Then the cashier issues the invoice to the customer who pays it and the cashier gives him his meal
If a product is missing from Poivre Sel he rings their supplier to see if the product is available the office manager checks the database to see if the product is still in stock

If the product is available we ask for the quantity of this product x at Poivre Sel which will determine the quantity and then notify the supplier who will be able to prepare an invoice and send it once the invoice is received and paid the stock manager will supply the product at Poivre Sel

If the product is no longer available the supplier asks for salt and pepper if he wants to order if the answer is no it is the end of the process if it is yes the supplier sends all the information invoice delivery date by e mail
The process starts with the arrival of the worker at Emerson
A renewal contract is when the end of his last contract is greater than 12 months
He goes to the line manager who welcomes him then he signs the contract and receives the badge
Later the line manager accompanies him to the social store
He begins his training and medical supervision and the process is over for him
If the duration of his contract is less than 12 months it is considered as a first contract
Therefore the worker is registered at the guard post then he is greeted by the head of the department who signs the contract and accompanies him to the social store and shows the worker the factory
Later the HR Business Partner transmits the Welcome Pack to the worker then the training coordinator receives singled documents and classifies documents in personal files
If an IT account must be created the training coordinators must first present and then send the signature of the IT policy
If not the worker can receive induction training and medical supervision directly
The process starts with the expiration of the contract
Then an exit interview takes place with the temporary worker and the coordinator his release date is encoded on HR Access the human resources management software package
The C4 the unemployment certificate and the certificate of employment is sent and issued to the worker by the coordinator then who then archives the paper file
After that the worker returns first clothes and keys at the social store and then the badge after the last score
Finally the HR Payroll Specialist triggers the bonus at the end of year in HR access applies the legislation on payment of the days after discharge clears RHT and RTT hours and the process is ended
The process starts with the payment of a deposit
Then the HP Payroll Specialist emails to horses managers before 10 a m to conclude it
Later he carries out a different point of the checklist and encodes down payment work on the HR Access software
He then downloads the payment batch on the bank s website and requests the lot signature to the Finance Manager who signs it
Finally the HP Payroll Specialist checks the sent lot and the worker receives the salary
The process begins with the requirement of the Emerson Company

The plant HR director invites the hierarchical manager to establish the schedule of objective meetings who will then carry out the evaluation with his employee via the HR Access pre software and will then transmit to the plant HR director
if the manager has received the evaluations he must review them otherwise the plant HR director will invite the hierarchical manager again to review the evaluations and continue the process
If the assessment is understandable the plant HR director if we need training if so we set up training and we evolve the performance of the end of the year and the performance assessment is completed

If the evaluation sent is incomprehensible the plant HR director discusses with the hierarchical manager who will complete and inform the collaborator who will send the document back to the plant HR director for review evaluation and the process continues normally
The process starts when a position becomes available

The HR Business Partner drafts the internal announcement and the HR Director validates the content of the announcement via the HR Access pre software then sends it to the HR Business Partner for the dissemination of the internal announcement
The HR Business Partner determines the evaluation criteria and then receives the applications by email
The HR Business Partner conducts interviews and tests and evaluates them afterwards
If the candidates respond to the applications of the function they are informed by email and their personal data is deleted with the HR access pre software and finally they are ready to be hired
If the candidates do not respond to the applications of the function they consult the reserve of spontaneous applications
The first business process is inbound logistics
An employee takes care of placing the order with the suppliers
All the raw materials needed to manufacture the finished products are stored in a large refrigerated hall within the company
There is also a storage room that serves as a freezer because some materials arrive frozen
The process of outbound logistics is quite similar to that of inbound logistics
First of all the company receives requests for the delivery of goods from outside supermarkets small shops
Then Goumanisto checks its stocks to see if it has the quantities requested by the buyers
If it does not have them it will send a note to inform the purchasing company of the impossibility of supplying the quantities requested
The purchasing company can also decide to maintain the order in which case Goumanisto will produce the missing products
Once the products are available the company will make up pallets that will be sent to the various stores via a delivery company
As far as the recruitment process is concerned it starts when a person shows interest in working for the company
For operators Goumanisto either uses a temporary employment agency to provide the necessary manpower or receives unsolicited applications most of which are based on the knowledge of existing workers
Each recruitment procedure consists of a minimum of 2 sometimes 3 interviews with the applicant
The first one is with the direct manager i e the operations manager if the company is looking to hire an operator
The second interview takes place in the presence of the company s managers
Following this second interview they decide whether or not the person is suitable
Production is a very important business process at Goumanisto
About 50 people are employed in production and almost half of them come from the sheltered workshop
The first room is made up of a recently acquired machine it allows the various products to be cut very quickly and precisely
Four to five workers are needed for this machine to work properly
Then there is another machine that weighs the cut products and divides them into different batches according to the quantities required
The next step is the reception of the products and their packaging
This step is done by production line
Currently there is a manual line with 10 people and an automated line with 5 people
The automatic line checks that the machines properly close the boxes with plastic paper then the manual line closes the boxes with plastic lids
Goumanisto s objective is to acquire a new automated line by February 2021
Finally the various plastic boxes have to be closed and packed in cardboard boxes both operations are still done manually
This one could be a good candidate for automation
Indeed the labelling and the placing of the products packed in the cardboard boxes are still done manually so it would represent a saving of time if the company were to automate this process
R D is also an important process for the organization
Members are looking for new product ideas that may appeal to consumers
Most often the company uses market research done by the wholesale distribution to whom it sells its products instead of doing its own surveys
Then they analyze the results of market research in order to embark on the development of new ideas of products
The point of product ideas is obviously that these products can be sold in large quantities and at a lower price
Then they compute the potential costs of producing these new product ideas
If these can be profitable and lead to profit subsequently they are validated by the R D department and presented to the general council
On the other hand if they could not be profitable everything falls apart and the process stops
It will therefore be necessary to start all over from the development of new product ideas
The process starts when a client wants to employ temporary workers
The client sends an email with a job description to the agency
An Asap consultant analyzes the job description
Then he checks if there is an existing profile in the agency s database
If a matching profile has been found the process to employ a candidate begins
If the candidate has been employed the process ends
If he has not been employed the consultant will recheck in the database in order to search for another potential profile
If one is found the loop is going again
If not an announcement is published on the agency site
Moreover the consultant has to check the specificity of the job
Indeed when the client wants a very specific candidate the agency has to actively research a candidate in addition to the published announcement
When the job does not require any specific skills the consultant only needs to wait for candidates to propose themselves
Whether it would be a specific or a non specific job when a candidate respondsto the announcement the to employ a candidate process can start
If the candidate has been employed the process ends
If the candidate has not been employed the consultant researches or waits again for a candidate to answer the announcement
However if the agency can not find a candidate fast enough the client must send a message to the agency to ask them to stop the process
Indeed the client works with several agencies so if another agency finds a candidate before Asap the client has to warn Asap
So when Asap receives a message from the client the agency must stop his searching process
The process starts when a profile of interim which matches with the announcement has been found
The first step is to call the candidate for a phone screening
After the phone call the candidate and the consultant agree for a date for a meeting
Another option is that the consultant realized during the phonescreening that the candidate was not suitable for the job
If so the process ends
If a meeting has been agreed the consultant sends an email to the candidate with a confirmed date and some information over the meeting
On the convenued day the candidate goes to the meeting and the consultant rules the meeting
The meeting starts when the candidate arrives
So the consultant can start the meeting
Before discussing specific topics of the job he has to check the candidate references
After the discussion the candidate has to pass a cognitive test
The meeting ends when he leaves
After the meeting the consultant sends a report over the meeting to the client
Then they have to wait for the client to respond
When the client sends a feedback of the report to the agency there are two possibilities
On one hand if the feedback is bad the client does not want the candidate so the agency must send him a rejection message
In this case the process ends
On the other hand if the feedback is good the client wants the candidate so the agency must send him an approval message
After sending the message the consultant makes the contract that he sends for the candidate to confirm and sign the contract
The candidate resends the signed contract to the agency which then sends the contract to the client
In this case the candidate is employed and the process ends
When the social secretary of ASAP receives the hours worked by the candidate for the client the process can start
The first step is to inform the bank to pay the hours worked
When the bank receives the message from ASAP she has to pay the worked hours to the candidate s bank account
The candidate is then informed that he has received the payment
The candidate checks if the payment is correct
If it is the case the process is fulfilled
If it is not he must inform the agency about the payment error

On the side of the agency if she doesn t receive a message from the candidate the process is fulfilled but when a payment error message is received the agency must check if the candidate has been paid too much or not enough paid
When the candidate has not been paid enough the bank has to pay the extra hours on the candidate bank account and the process is fulfilled
If the candidate has been too much paid the agency must request a refund from the candidate
So the candidate pays the hours not worked to the bank and the process ends
We can imagine that the candidates would not send an error message if he has been paid too much
However some of them do and ASAP counts on their honesty
The process starts when an employee evaluation is needed
The superior calls the employee
They plan a meeting together
After the phone call the superior sends an email with the confirmed date of the meeting
On the said date the employee goes to the meeting
So the superior can start the meeting
He first checks if the KPIs of the employee are good
Then he discusses with him about his general feeling in the company
After that the superior can end the meeting
When the meeting is finished and the employee is left the superior makes a feedback that he sends to his employee
From there there are three possibilities

Either the feedback is good so nothing happens or it is the first bad feedback so the superior warns his employee or it is the second bad feedback so the superior sends a breach of contract to his employee
After each possibility the process ends
We can surely say that the breach of the contract can be negotiated depending on the circumstances
When the agency has given a service to one of his clients a consultant makes an invoice
The business manager then checks the invoice
The invoice may not be correct if the client has had a credit note on a past delivery
If the invoice is not correct the business manager resends the invoice to the consultant and he has to make the invoice again
If the invoice is correct the consultant can send the invoice to the client
When the invoice has been sent the consultant waits for the payment
If the payment arrives within 5 days the process is fulfilled
If it is not the case the consultant calls the client with a first warning
After this call if the payment has been completed within 5 days the process ends
If not the account manager calls the client for a second warning
The client has to pay within 5 days to finish the process if not the account manager sends an email about a potential bailiff venue and informs the bailiff about his potential venue
To finish the process there are two possibilities
Either the client pays his debt within 50 days and the process ends or the account manager contacts the bailiff and the process is finished
the delays are so short because ASAP has to pay the temporary workers one week after the last day of the mission As mentioned above

The process starts with the interest of the client in finding a solution to the digital transformation his company needs the first task is to propose and describe the 3 Bizz Online packs get a response from the client charge him and inform DJM

The first contact always starts within Proximus stores but the salesman only acts as an intermediate and only during the selling phase after fulfilling the order he steps out of the conversation and an employee of DJM takes this over firstly the manager

The process starts when a customer enters a Proximus shop either the customer goes to a Proximus shop because he is a freelancer interested in the Bizz online packs or the seller proposes the Bizz online packs to him
If the customer refuses the offer the process is over
On the other hand if the customer is interested in the pack the seller offers him the choice between 3 packs S M L
These packs are categorized according to their size options and functionality
They go from the most basic to the most specific
Once the customer has made his choice the seller informs a DJM manager of the customer s new request via an ERP system set up between the 2 companies DJM and Proximus
Bizz online employees then start a discussion with the customer in order to prepare the website as well as possible
When the website is prepared it is sent to the customer who can then request the latest changes if he wants before the website is published
If the client is satisfied with the website it is published on the internet and the process is completed
If the customer does not respond to the message sent within 5 days a reminder message is sent
This process starts when the client who has already chosen either the M pack or the L pack is interested in receiving an e shop as an option in his pack
After invoicing in a Proximus shop the request of the client goes to a project manager of Bizz online who gets in touch with the client so that they can discuss the project
Then it s the webmaster who produces the e shop taking into account the suggestions of the client and does the modifications if necessary
This process ends when the e shop is published
The process starts when the manager receives a complaint
He then registers it and transfers it to the webmaster
The webmaster analyses the complaint and if more information is needed he recontacts the client to receive the missing pieces of information
If he can resolve it directly he skips those steps and resolves it
Then the process ends
The process starts when a jobseeker sends his or her application to DJM by e mail

The project manager receives the application and checks whether it contains the CV and covering letter whether it contains the basic data such as name and surname and whether the applicant has the required diploma to work at DJM
If the documents are incomplete the project manager will inform the applicant
If the documents are complete the project manager will contact the applicant through one of the channels provided on the CV to find a time to place an interview
After the interview if the candidate is hired the project manager will send a rejection email
After the interview if the candidate is hired an email is also sent to inform him her of the news
The project manager then begins to enter the information collected from the application
If he she notices that he she is missing data he she contacts the candidate again to complete the application with the missing data
Then he creates the contract which he then sends
The process starts when an employee is needed
Then the first task is made by the Head of department who has to give specific criteria of the job requirements skills needed
Once the task is completed the HR employee has to see if it is a specific more special demand or not
Usually for nurses they will look at spontaneous applications on the hospital website
For more specific functions they will externalize the process and recruit via Forum
For more special requests for example energy engineer they make an offer on the website themselves
After having collected the CV the HR employee has to to make a selection based on the head of department s criteria
If there are a lot of applications he can decide to filter the candidates by doing a written exam in order to screen people
Due to the written exam he has to select candidate and review application
Once the task is completed he has to decide if he approve or not the candidate
If he didn t approve it a rejection email will be sent to the applicant and the process is finished
In the other case the HR employee will have to schedule an online interview
The head of the department has to conduct the personal interview and based on that he will decide if he hire or not the candidate
If he doesn t want to hire him or her a rejection email is sent to the candidate and the process is finished
In the other case the head of department has to inform the HR employee that the applicant is hired
Finally the HR employee has to create an administrative file with the applicant s information and create the employment contract
Once the tasks are completed the process is finished = applicant employed
The process takes place in emergencies
It starts when a patient arrives at the emergency room
The emergency service has to register the patient and take his or her vital parameters as blood pressure and so on
These data are entered in the DPI system by the emergency service which allows the doctor even if he is not on site to consult that information
The doctor specialist has to check the patient s data
based on that he has to evaluate the urgency
If he considers that it is not urgent he has to give instructions to the emergency doctor
Then the emergency doctor has to treat the patient schedule an appointment and discharge him or her
Once the tasks are completed the process is finished
In the other case which means that the doctor specialist considers that it is an urgency he has to inform the nurses and check bed availability at the same time
Nurses will then register the person in their department
They absolutely have to have the approval of the medical specialist before they admit someone
They cannot register a patient without that
Finally the nurses have to move the patient from the emergency room to the room service
The process starts when medications are needed
The first task is made by the nurse who has to check their department s drug needs for each patient
The nurse then group everything together and send the order by fax usually to the pharmacy
In all hospitals there is a pharmacy so orders are sent there and directly processed
The pharmacy checks if they have everything usually they have everything
If some medications are missing they have to inform the nurse of the product s non availability
Then they have to check the availability of the medications in another service and send someone to take them
Once they have received the medications they have to notify the nurse prepare all the medications and finally deliver them to the nurse
The last task is made by the nurse who has to prepare the medications for each patient
Once the task is done the process is finished = medications prepared
There are several possible cases
In case of end of contract At the end of the contract replacement contract fixed term contract there is nothing is simply over for the employee
In case of dismissal Dismissal can be caused by many things usual causes
If the dis missal is sufficiently justified HR will take care of giving notice
In the event of a decision to discontinue redirection to another hospital it is up to the employee to request advance notice
HR will ensure that the notice period is acceptable
This process especially concerns the Meuse Tube Clinic in Flmalle this clinic belongs to the CHBA group
However the process cannot be the same as in Seraing
When a patient wishes to make an appointment he can do so through three different channels this can be done by phone by mail or on the spot at the counter
In all three cases the patient will come across the reception desk of the clinic
However if it is done by e mail it may take longer to get an answer
The receptionist will look at the places available and suggest an appointment date to the patient then an appointment will be scheduled
The person at the reception desk will then check his or her contact details via his or her identity card and health insurance
The patient has to pay directly on the spot he will eventually receive an invoice
After waiting in the waiting room the doctor sees the patient
He will check the patient s medical history in the CPR computerized patient record examine the patient and give recommendations for treatment
Eventually the doctor may request additional tests if the situation requires it or even transfer the patient to the emergency room in case of an emergency
He can also schedule a hospitalization if he wants to follow the patient in real time
The invoicing service will take care of the invoice which will depend on the technical services performed during the consultation the status of the person and his or her health insurance company
The maintenance and repair process uses one main software Carpark

Indeed Carpark allows the management of all the vehicles from all the parks thanks to its database that includes all the information necessary about the vehicles from all the subsidiaries the number plate the intern references but also the location of the maintenance the maintenance plan that suits the vehicle the most according to the recommendation of the suppliers Moreover drivers also use Carpark in order to encode the kilometers travelled with the busses which allows the automated planning of the maintenance every 15 000 or 30 000 kilometers depending on the bus
Those planned maintenances are sorted 1 500 kilometers in advance by the software in order for the technical and maintenance head to be able to plan their actual execution with the mechanics
Of course more completion dates can be added manually in accordance with a specific date of a specific number of kilometers travelled
Lastly Carpark keeps the history of all the maintenances and repairs that have been done on each vehicle
The repair process starts with the transmission of a complaint through Carpark

With this complaint a driver signals a damage a breakdown or an accident after having made a research with the number of the vehicle in order to verify that the damage has not already been signaled and avoid any duplication

The content of the complaint is the following the problem the vehicle concerned its kilometers travelled and if the driver wants to his email address or his phone number in order to receive a message when the complaint is taken in charge
The technical and maintenance head can consult the list of all the complaints in Carpark
He then decides of the moment the complaint has to be treated depending on the urgency of the problem

If the problem is considered as urgent the technical and maintenance head directly visits the garage where the repair is going to be done in order to find mechanics who are available to take the bus in charge

Otherwise the repair is planned for a later day and will be taken in charge during the daily morning meeting between the technical and maintenance head and the mechanics where the work of the day is divided up
The technical and maintenance head creates the workshop sheet related to each repair
This sheet includes a description of the problem as well as the work that has to be done by the mechanics and is identified by a specific codebare

If the driver who transmitted the complaint gave a phone number or an email address a message is automatically sent to him when the workshop sheet is created in order to let him know that the complaint is taken into account and that the bus is sent to the garage for repairs
Following the daily planning of the mechanics the technical and maintenance head sends the workshop sheets to the ones concerned by the repair
With the use of a clocking software each mechanic scans the barcode of the workshop sheet to indicate when he takes it in charge and then when he is done with the execution of its content
That enables the technical and maintenance head to know which repairs are ongoing and which ones are finished but also to know the workforce that has been required for each of them
Moreover the mechanic indicates in the workshop sheet every piece that he used for the repair by scanning the barcode of them which also allows an easy following of the evolution of the stock
Once the mechanic has finished the repairs the completed workshop sheet is sent back to the technical and maintenance head who closes it
That finally permits the creation of the invoice as well as the suppression of the complaint in the list in Carpark
Of course in order to make repairs on busses it is essential to have efficient stock maintenance of the pieces required for those repairs
It is the role of the technical and maintenance head to create the purchase orders communicate them to the suppliers take the delivery control and approve the invoices
Once a new piece arrives either it is immediately used because it has been ordered for a specific repair that is ongoing or urgent or the piece enters the stock

Each piece of the stock is identified by a particular barcode which is also useful to keep track of the pieces used during each repair as mentioned previously and has a particular place in the warehouse determined by a departement a shelf and a level
Keolis Belgium and its subsidiaries owns many gas stations with their fuel pumps but they also manage the tankage of other stations in areas where they don t own any cistern

This mix of their own tanks and the external tanks is centralized in one software Telenaro where the internal tanks are continuously updated and the data from their external clients are imported two times a month

Telenaro gathers all the societies vehicles of the group internal and external drivers and data related type of vehicle maximum level of the fuel tank baseline consumption current consumption and all the other details linked with the tankage
That permits automated statistics about the consumption of fuel as a way of efficient control despite the size of the entire group and the number of stations vehicles and cisterns
Moreover the forecasting of the resupply of each cistern is based on an estimated range computed from the average daily consumption registered
Lastly Telenaro keeps the history of all the deliveries of fuel the deltas given by the probes see further the alerts from problems during a delivery etc
Any anomaly in Telenaro can be corrected manually by an operator
A new system of probes installed in some of the cisterns of the company gives an on live view of the fuel level
In parallel to the probes the level is also computed from the documented tanks and resupplies in Telenaro

The delta between the probed level and the computed one allows the operators to identify any problems in the supply of fuel or in the tankage of some vehicles i e the amount of fuel delivered do not correspond to the one indicated on the invoice of the supplier a driver tries to defraud by taking some fuel for its 7 own personal consumption in winter a quite big difference can come from the high consumption of the heaters for the scholar cars
The probe of a cistern also detects if the amount of fuel varies whereas no delivery is ongoing because of a leak of fuel or a theft which triggers an alarm
It even gives the level of water in the cistern due to the condensation in the cisterns so that the operators know when they need to evacuate some of that water
Most importantly the probes replace the previously needed and costly physical presence of an operator in order to verify and control the proper conduct of each resupply
The starting point of the resupply of a cistern is its low level of fuel

To know if any tankage is required the manager of a society can easily visualize the level of each cistern of its society thanks to Telenaro and its icons and colored level bars see the adjacent illustration
In addition the system automatically sends an alert to the manager when a particular level of fuel is reached whereas no tankage is planned yet
When the operator decides that an order is needed he calls for tenders and the best price gets the order
Then the manager makes the order to the supplier and sends an email to the subsidiaries in order to inform the local managers of the upcoming resupply
All the ongoing orders are also registered in Telenaro

When the delivery man arrives at the location of the delivery the operator in charge at the station gives him the delivery probe that has to be scanned at the pump to allow the tankage as well as to confirm to Telenaro that the delivery is made
After the tankage the delivery man encodes the amount of fuel he just delivered and the system will compare that amount to the one measured by the probe
If they do not correspond the system asks the delivery man to re encode the amount and makes the verification again
After three times asking for re encodage if the encoded amount and the probed amount still do not correspond the system sends a message to the firm in order to signal it
Then the delivery is confirmed by the system to the operator in charge as well as to Telenaro

The system automatically creates and sends the invoice to the society that benefited from the delivery and a copy to the manager in charge so that he is able to control if the delivery corresponds to the negotiations made at the moment of the ordering
It also generates the excise documents for the recovering as well as the official declaration for the Ministry
When an operator from any department wants to make a purchase he has to fill in an investment request
Four different investment requests are used in Keolis Belgium for
? Rolling stock buses for regular lines scholar lines tourisms but also trailers for the luggages
? No rolling stock supplies for the garages tools compressors
? Properties buildings but also air conditioning garage doors led lights bus wash
? IT infrastructures cabling laptops desktops servers magnetic access cards surveillance cameras
See the annexes for samples of the four investment requests
Once the investment request is completed the amount of the expense is controlled by the purchase department regarding the budgetization of the year

If the management validates the purchase the investment request has now to be signed by the supervisor of the departments concerned by the purchase as well as a head of the purchase department in order to acknowledge the validation of the purely budgetary aspect
Once the investment request has been signed it is sent via email to the supplier that launches the delivery
In order to close the process the invoice still has to be validated by the purchase department that confirms the purchase
The firm has a few master contracts with some suppliers and all the subsidiaries are strongly encouraged to make their purchases through those master contracts as a priority

Of course case by case exceptions are possible but this tolerance toward the appeal to other suppliers is supervised if a department constantly makes purchases with other suppliers that the ones concerned by the master contracts negotiated by the organisation an operational manager or an head of the subsidiary will make sure it stops
In fact 76 of the purchases of the organisation are made within master contracts
For example all the OPEX Operational Expenditures that concern office supplies are subject to master contracts

If no master contract concerns the purpose of the purchase and if the amount if that purchase exceeds 5 000 euros three offers generally have to be collected before making a choice of a supplier in order to compare the price quality ratios the delivery time the quality of the after sales service etc
here again exceptions are of course possible
The final choice of a supplier is made by the purchase department in tandem with the ones who will benefit from the purchase
Besides those master contracts the company also has some price conventions and other pre negotiated purchase terms with some other suppliers
Whenever the company wants to broaden the number of clients it reaches the very first step concerns the work of the marketing team
The aim is to get information about potential clients in order to determine if the company can propose valuable services to them and conclude an order
This preparation is essential because it is the foundation of the sale process the sales representatives from the commercial team have to be well prepared for the coming negotiation
Once the information has been collected through market analysis the commercial team contacts the potential client and a first negotiation takes place

The aim is to determine whether the client is interested by the potential offer and the sales representative bases its argumentation on the client analysis previously communicated by the marketing department
After the negotiation and if the client is indeed interested a first offer is created
This offer needs to be signed by several managers if the offer is not appropriated it might compromise the sale
After having been signed the offer is sent to the client by email
If the client directly accepts the offer the sale is validated and the processes of invoicing and delivering can start

But if the client is not entirely satisfied with the proposition more negotiations can take place in order to have the approval of the client while still respecting the frames and goals from the management

Repeating the last circle several times would be very heavy due to the long approbation chain but that almost never occurs generally if the second offer is still not validated by the client the sale is cancelled
At the beginning of each month the account of more than 40 small societies that all kept their legal entity need to be closed in 4 working days
To do so a lot of accountants work in the subsidiaries and each of them close two or three files within 4 days
Their work mainly consists in verifying and gathering the invoices as well as the charges
For the invoices the ones that concern the regular services and the scholar services come directly from the manager at the moment of the service provision and immediately verified by the accountant
On the other side for the taxis the tourism sector invoices to be drawn up are used because the very end of the service needs to be reached in order to know the total costs engaged
For the charges the accountants have to look into the salaries and wages
In the organisation those are based on the real pay on what has actually been paid with almost no accounting provisions

All the other types of charges are also taken into account rent provisions fuel costs charges from invoices that still need to be drawn up properties maintenance As mentioned right above within 4 working days starting at the 1st of the month the accountants have to close their files and send them to the management accountants for verification and for a fist analysis
Keolis Belgium comprises 3 management accountants one for Wallonia one for Flanders and one for Brussel
Thus on the 4th of the month they verify the work of the accountants according to the budgetization of the month and the year the fluctuations from month to month etc
They have a more global vision that is both operational and budgetary
After receiving the approval from the management accountants the accountants inject the files in BOFINANCE the reporting tool used by Keolis SA that has its headquarters in France
The headquarter then consolidates the accounts and adds on top operations such as adjusted depreciation expenses to make those accounts correspond to the International Financial Reporting Standards

The 3 management accountants then receive the consolidated accounts consolidate them again into 3 reports one for each region and a second analysis takes place estimation of the gaps between the non consolidated and the consolidated accounts identification of the impact of the events of the month i e the price variation of the fuel on the turnover as well as on each part of the business of the organisation scolar part tourism part regular services part etc
This analysis is a from the real to the budget analysis a waterfall of all the impacts is made in order to obtain the budget of the month
Currently the impact of the covid crisis is at the center of those monthly analyses
If the impact on scholar transportation is relatively small the one on the tourism sector is huge since all the activities are stationary
Moreover the reinforcements asked by La TEC that needed more vehicles also have had consequences
On the 5th day of the month the management accountants send the 3 reports to the directors of each region
It is indeed important that the results of their analysis are communicated with the operational managers

Finally on the 6th day of the month the management accountant of Wallonia consolidates the 3 reports in order to obtain one consolidated report for Belgium which is required by the headquarter in France

Empty bottles are returned by the customers once the bottles are received we sort the types of bottles before washing them afterwards we control the cleanliness of the bottles and the quality of the bottles with a laser to detect the slightest defect
If the bottles have defects they are rejected and if not they are kept
Then the bottles are filled captured labelled and marked with the expiry date
Then the bottles go to the warehouse for storage
AB Inbev needs bottles so they will order the bottles from their suppliers

The suppliers check the order if it is accepted a confirmation is sent to AB Inbev then the suppliers plan the transportation then they send the invoice and at the same time the bottles are delivered by truck to AB Inbev

Once the trucks are received AB Inbev unload the trucks and then they check the goods if everything is good the bottles are stored if not AB Inbev sends the bad products back to the suppliers and the suppliers will send a new invoice and the good products or missing products to AB Inbev who will unload the trucks check the goods before storing them
purchase order is received at the logistics department if it is a new customer it has to be entered into the VPO System which is used by all AB Inbev breweries
The VPO manager will then send the order information to the warehouse which will then check the availability of the beer for the order
If everything is available the order is prepared otherwise a request is sent to the packaging department to produce the missing beer
Once the beer is ready it is delivered and the invoice is sent to the customer
AB InBev receives unsolicited applications but also via other channels Indeed and Forem the People department receives applications
1 CV screening consists of the elimination of CVs that do not meet the criteria requested by the company and when information is missing we send an e mail to warn the candidate
If they do not meet the criteria their application will not have been selected
2 The telephone interview the recruiter will contact the selected candidates by telephone 5 10 minutes
If he is convinced he will invite the candidate to the recruitment morning
3 The recruitment morning is a collective interview there is a series of tests
Successful candidates are contacted by telephone to invite them to the next interview with the N+1 or N+2
4 Interview with the department manager The manager turns his interview more towards the personality of the candidate
If the candidate is accepted he or she is invited to a training course
5 Form Alim training Form Alim is a training course specially created for production operators in the food industry
6 The first seasonal contract and coaching When signing the contract the candidate is invited to the People Department to complete documents

7 The permanent contract If the employee receives a sufficient number of positive feedbacks his manager is satisfied with his work and ABI has the opportunity to do so he will be offered a permanent contract
Different types of malts are put together in the tank
They are crushed in order to extract the fermentable sugar
The resulting product is then mixed with heated water in a vat
Then the liquid is pumped into another tank in which the husks of the grains are separated from the suicidal liquid
The liquid obtained is then subjected to strong heat in a kettle

After this step we will be able to proceed to the fermentation process we will add hops and yeast which will convert the sugar into beer then we will cool the beer filter it and add CO2 to make the beer sparkling
So all that remains is to wait until the beer is mature 3 weeks before it can be sold and consumed
The aim of this process is to answer positively or not to an employee s holiday request
The process starts when an employee makes a request which is received by a human resource analyst
The analyst takes charge of the request by changing its state to  pending  which means that the demand is neither approved nor rejected
Then the request is sent to the manager of the requester s department
This is the first step that the request has to go through
If the manager rejects the request the analyst changes its state to  rejected  and the process ends with a notification sent to the employee
Otherwise if the manager accepts the request the analyst changes the state of the request to  approved  and the first step is done
