After that the request also has to be granted by the human resource manager
The aim of this process is to allocate human resources to a specific task
To understand it properly it is common sense yet important to note a human resource cannot be assigned to a project if this one doesn t already exist
In the same way we cannot create a project before having a customer to which it relates
So in the most common cases the manager will want to allocate a human resource to a specific project so he is going to trigger the process by its higher start event
Then he is going to create and fulfill the new resource page and add it on the project
That leads straightly to the higher end event and this is the shortest way to go through the process
Otherwise if after trying to create this page the software realizes that this new resource doesn t refer to an existing project the process leads the analyst to the creation of this one
This is the role of the first gateway
After successfully filling each step the process brings back the analyst on the first line and to the first end event

In the same way if during the creation of a new project the software realizes that this project doesn t relate to a registered customer then the process leads the analyst in the encoding of this new customer
This is the role of the purple gateway
After having registered this new customer the process brings the employee back to the second and then to the first line that leads again to the first end event
Of course we could imagine the case where the analyst would only want to create a new project or to register a new customer without immediately allocating a resource to it
This is the role of the second and the third start events which respectively leads to the second and third end events
This business process is triggered when the training manager wants to create a training
If the training has not already been taught in the past then the manager has to create a whole new training
cfr linked subprocess
Otherwise the manager only has to schedule the session of related training called then a session and contact the external trainer of his choice specialized in this field
As the attendance needs to be recorded for obvious financial and organizational reasons the manager establishes a list of attendees thanks to the form sent earlier on and the IT training system
1 week before the training s day a reminder is sent by email to the attendees
After the session the manager has to perform 3 tasks simultaneously ask for a debrief apply the post training process and update attendees skills in the database
That being done the whole process finally ends
Subprocess If a training has not been given yet on a particular subject in the past the manager has to design the training and fill a form with the details of it

If the HR director does not accept the training framework for various reasons the training being too expensive too time consuming for the human resources etc the manager has to re evaluate it and redesign the training
Otherwise the manager can select the language the training will be given in French English or both
Finally he has to save the choices made before and this creates the training in their IT training system
This BPMN is relative to the internal invoicing and the payment of an internal contract
It happens when an entity of the group ARHS offers its services to another entity
The accounting officer of the entity providing its services receives the framework which is the name given to an internal contract from the indebted entity s accounting department
The latter selects lines corresponding to the framework and records it in Interco which is the software used for internal contracts
After that the accounting officer clicks on the button send to invoice and the invoice is registered as to be received in FICO which is the general accountancy software
Finally the accounting officer waits for the payment and sends a reminder after 30 days of waiting to the indebted entity
They do not charge any kind of late fees to each other as they are all part of the same group
Once it is received the invoice gets archived
If the company finds an interesting profile the HR employee searches for information about them creates a proposal and sends them an email
If the person rejects the proposal or does not respond to it within three weeks the process ends
However if they accept the proposal the human resources employee calls them to set up a meeting a week later
Once the interview has been made the HR employee arranges a visit to the company for a moment later
Once the visit and the interview have been carried out a skills test for the potential future employee has to be taken
Depending on their result the company decides whether to hire them or not
If the answer is yes the company considers a contract proposal and calls the candidate to discuss it
The company is then awaiting for their response
The latter can accept or refuse the contract
If the answer is negative a new call is scheduled to renegotiate the employment clauses
If accepted the employee is hired and their profile is registered in the company system
Another way to get into the hiring process is to apply through an online form on the company website or to spontaneously apply to the company
In the first case the documents of the applicants their CV and the online form will be analyzed by a human resources employee
In the second case the employee will only analyze the documents and CVs of the applicants
Based on these documents the employee decides whether or not to go on with the process by calling the candidate if selected
The process starts when a message from the MRP system2 is received

Indeed to manufacture a pump for a customer they need material resources and the MRP system knows it so it sends notifications to the central purchasing department that will then take care of this information
Then three activities have to be done in parallel  Create an X Flow3  Request for quotation to the supplier  Do a framework agreement price matrix it is done to calculate costs of the pump
When these 3 tasks are completed the company places an order with its supplier who then takes care of the delivery
Then the product is sent to the quality control to check the quality of the products received
If the quality does not meet the expectations they are sent back to the supplier and the supplier delivers better products or does some repairs on them
If the quality is good they are sent to the Central purchasing department with the invoice

When the invoice is received they have to validate the invoice in order to confirm that everything is ok and matches the information in the X Flow which allows the accounting department to free up money and the process ends like this
The process starts when the planning department receives a sales order from the customer
They are then able to prepare a preliminary planning and to give feedback to the project manager for the kick off meeting KOM

Then the master planner attends the KOM and thanks to the minutes of meeting MOM that he receives by mail he can update the planning and save a deadlines baseline that contains all the project s milestones
The planning department can then launch the production order by putting it into the SAP system
Then meetings take place each week until the end of the production

In case there are delays due to some modifications in the plan of the pump or delays due to late deliveries from the supplier the project manager is informed and he gives this information to the planning department
The planning is then updated
The whole company is supposed to follow this planning and to act according to it
The process ends when the pump is done
The process starts when an idea of conception comes to the mind of somebody in the business unit
Then the business unit makes a project proposal and a detailed analysis is done
Then the product development team does the technical specifications and after that the stakeholders make an analysis of the product and decide whether it is feasible or not
If they say that it is infeasible the process ends
But if it is feasible then the business unit the product development team and the operations and procurement team meet during a kick off meeting to talk about the project
Then those three teams work together in order to make a deeper analysis and conceptual generic drawings
Then they still work together to set up a detailed drawing with technical specifications this time
When those tasks are done the product development team realises final manufacturing drawings with all the composing parts
Then the three teams above mentioned have to gather all the data to put it in the manufacturing file
After all these activities the pump is ready to be sold so the product development team puts it in the product catalogue and the process ends
The process starts when the production order is received from the SAP system
The workers can then take the raw parts needed for a specific pump in the warehouse
When it is done they send a notification to inform the SAP system that this step of the production is done

Then the system sends a work order to the workers in the machining service and two activities are done in parallel the transformation of raw parts that is done by the workers and the one that is done by the subcontractor
When all the pieces are transformed by the subcontractor or by the workers they can store those finished materials in the warehouse and once again inform the SAP system
Then they receive another work order from SAP to pre assemble the pump
When it is done they store the subsets and inform SAP
Once again they receive a work order and they have to do two activities in parallel do the piping and assemble the bareshaft pump4
Then when those two activities are done they can assemble the final pump and check its performance thanks to an internal and an external quality controller
If the performance is of good quality the pump is dispatched
A notification is then sent to SAP and the process ends
If the performance is poor they solve the problem and then they check again if it is ok
The process starts when the customer notifies a problem to the after sales department
They receive the defective material at the plant and they create a file
Then they are able to estimate a quote
The next step is assessing the problem
If the problem comes from the customer the warranty will not be applied but if the company is responsible for it the customer will have to pay nothing for the repairs
In the case where the customer is under warranty they apply it
If he is not under warranty a final quote is set up and the customer has to accept or to reject it
If he rejects the quote the file is closed and the material is sent back
The company can still charge him for the time they spent on the pump so they can also create an invoice before sending back the material
In the case where he accepts the quote or right after having applied the warranty they create a work order WO
Then they get the material they need to do the repairs thanks to the central purchasing
Then they have to consider if those are small or big repairs
If a big repair has to be done they go on site to do it because of practical reasons then they create the invoice and the process ends
If it is only small repairs they do it at Sulzer s workshop and then they send back the material
Once it is done they create the invoice and the process ends
Before really getting into the recruitment process it is important to know that Resultance tries its best to approach young people
To do this Resultance is present in schools and on various recruitment sites to promote the company and attract young people
The recruitment process takes place in several stages
Applications are received by the HR managers who then sort and select the best applications
Once an application is selected an interview is set up between the candidate and the HR managers
Then the candidates selected after the first interview are interviewed by a partner of the firm

Once the candidate has been selected the integration phase begins the candidate will receive a salary package from the HR department and a mentor will be appointed to supervise the new candidate and help him or her integrate as well as possible
A form is sent to all members of the firm to inform them of the arrival of a new employee
The integration process On the first day the employee is welcomed by the HR department and the administrative assistant
The employee is given his or her work tools mobile phone PC car and is explained the IT tools used at Resultance
They are told what they need to know about the firm the company s values are explained to them and they receive their assignment
He will be attached to a project and will know the manager who is going to supervise it
The welcome continues with the godfather or godmother over a meal to immediately create a relationship and ensure that the new employee is well integrated
The employee is then monitored and supervised by his or her manager and feedback is given to ensure that he or she develops well
A diagnosis is launched at the customer s premises an employee will describe the company its level of performance in the different departments
Risks at the level of processes and organisation will be assessed
The intensity of the changes will also be highlighted by the employees responsible for the diagnosis
To do this Resultance uses the SWOT tool and focuses on the opportunities
Once the diagnosis has been established the employees will share the findings and recommendations resulting from the client s analysis
From this moment on improvement paths will be described and will reveal the quantitative and qualitative gains that can be made
Then a member of staff will draw up a detailed action plan in the form of a gantt chart for each area of improvement
Once the diagnosis has been made the areas for improvement put forward it is up to the management team to decide whether or not to take action
The diagnosis will make it possible to define the duration of the mission and the number of employees required for the project
Based on this an estimate can be drawn up and presented to the client
Based on the investigation and on a formal decision taken by the management team a project is launched
Resultance pursues the analysis of the client s company in order to gain credibility and establishes the collaborative relationship
The employees responsible for the project build new tools propose new working methods and processes
Workshops are set up at the client s premises to directly involve stakeholders in the changes proposed by Resultance employees
Each new proposal must be validated by the steering committee responsible for ensuring that a project runs smoothly within a company
The tools are then deployed in the field

In order to ensure that the methodologies are properly transformed into results Resultance employees working at the client s site set up and lead the teams to ensure that the new tools are actually implemented
The teams are monitored until they reach the objectives set by Resultance
This ensures a real collaborative relationship between Resultance and the client
To ensure that the project runs smoothly a meeting is held once a week with the Resultance project manager and the client s internal project manager
This makes it possible for example to resolve any problems immediately if there are any

In addition to this every 4 to 6 weeks a steering committee with the management committee of the client company is set up to take stock of the actions carried out in the project to take stock of progress and any problems encountered
This monitoring makes it possible to give new directions to the project or change priorities
And finally Resultance ensures the proper transfer of knowledge and tools put in place to ensure sustainability
The client is then autonomous and benefits from continuous improvement
When a new employee joins the company his or her objectives and expectations are entered into the database of a tool called Workday

This tool centralizes and automates all the decisions related to human resources management such as managing holidays and leaves evaluations sending reminder for deadlines and registering automated approvals
In addition this process requires little or no supervision
This process of human resources management ends when the employee leaves GSK

Once a customer has placed an order the documents related to the purchase are received at the factory while the documents related to transport and the products badge with date of production and expiry date are handled manually
The warehouse verifies on paper that the data on the pallets is consistent with the order
Then the papers are scanned and sent to the quality team
The quality team makes verifications before signing and archiving the file
After that the products related to the order can be released
This process starts when a client requests a pricing offer to the local Belgian GSK team
An employee receives the request and prepares a pricing offer
Then according to the 4 eyes principle another employee from the Belgian team checks the offer
If there is a discrepancy the offer is corrected
When the offer is finally approved it is sent to the central team in India to copy it in SAP
The central team signals that the offer is confirmed to the local Belgian team by email
When this email is received in Belgium the offer is confirmed to the client
There are 3 possibilities for GSK to receive an order for their products from a customer
The customer can place his order through a sales representative of GSK during a physical visit
This case applies mainly to the pharmacies
The representative encodes the order on a tablet connected to the GSK ordering system
The customer can also place orders by e mailing the company
When the e mail is received the customer service checks the availability of the products ordered
The order is checked and sent to the warehouse if the items are in stock
In case of shortage the customer is of course notified
The third possibility consists in the customer using GSK s platform thanks to a personal identifier interfaced with EDI Electronic Data Interchange
Once the order is confirmed it is sent to the warehouse
After receiving the order the warehouse verifies that the information is correct
Then a staff member in the warehouse picks up the different articles with a cart
Once the products are picked up they are boxed and packed
Then the order is placed on pallets to be delivered to the customer
The tracking of the order and the expected delivery time can be consulted at any time by the customer thanks to the label on the order
When the products are received by the customer the invoice is sent
This process starts when a customer has a complaint about the price or the quantity of one order
He or she has to contact the customer service
Even if the contact is made by phone an e mail has to be sent to have a written proof of the complaint
Then the customer service has to ask the sales manager if the correct price was applied the right quantity was sent
If it is the process ends with sending an email of rejection of complaint to the costumer
If the price quantity is not correct the customer service generates a credit note and send it to the sales manager who has to print sign scan before sending it back to the customer service
Then the customer service also has to print sign scan send it and reimburse the customer
The law obliges GSK to keep proof of the complaint for 7 years
This storage is currently done through paper format documents
There are two ways to find out something is missing
Due to the digital transformation most of the inventory is automatically done at the end of the day
So every morning the supply manager when he sees the ERP alert purchases the products missing or practically missing
The manager is constantly prospecting but if something is missing he does not have the time to ask every supplier to make a quote that is a support activity
The other way to find out something is missing is by a warehouse worker
Thanks to ERP it is hardly happening
But if while he is picking products something is missing or the quality is not good enough he will directly alert the supply manager so he will purchase new ones
Suppliers are listed in the supplier database where the manager can retrieve which product is from which supplier
The invoice is finally sent to the financial department where it will be paid
Most of the leads are firstly received by a telemarketer by mail or by a phone call
They will take the information about the client and insert them into the Customer database
We will assume that every lead is about B2B
If the client does not need delivery or a quote he should go to the cash and carry shop in Droixhe
The telemarketer will then send the address of the delivery to receive a day of delivery for the client
If for some reason the day proposed by the transporter does not suit the client the financial department will analyze if it could economically be possible to charter a truck just for him
If not the lead will be aborted
If the client agrees and does not need a physical appointment the telemarketer will make a quote
Otherwise he will attribute the client to a salesman available who will set an appointment and make the quote
When the first quote is made by the salesman or the telemarketer the client might refuse it or accept it
If the client accepts it the contract will be signed and the order made
If not he might not be interested anymore and the case would be closed or he might want a better quote
The salesman telemarketer will need approval from the financial department to lower prices or make a promotion
If it is not possible to do a better quote the case will be closed
If it is the salesman telemarketer will make the new quote which might once again be approved or refused by the client
And so on until the client declined the offer or consented to it
When the order arrived at the warehouse if there are some products that need to be pre commanded the manager will do so and the order will be handled as soon as delivered
Otherwise he will assign the order to an available worker
He will receive the order on his scanner
It indicates the emplacement of products and their quantity
If the product needed is not there the work must advise the manager so he can report the error corrects the database and purchases the product needed
Every time the picker picks something he must check the quality and the expiration date in order to avoid any return
When all the products of the order are picked the worker needs to check that the weight and the volume correspond to what is expected by the ERP
Then if everything is right the worker will confirm the order and emit the shipment order

If the order is canceled the financial department will determine the cancelation penalty and charge it to the customer and if the product was not shipped yet the manager will handle the product return
When the order is delivered the transporter sends a delivery note to the financial department
Then every Monday they emit the invoice for every customer delivered
If after 14 days they still do not have the payment they will send a reminder
If after another 14 days the order is still unpaid the debt recovery will start and the client will be stuck
The process starts when I wake up

Tennis is an expensive sport which requires a good equipment
When I feel my racket is not giving enough power anymore  I have to replace it by a new one
First of all  if it is not done  I need to determine my style of game
It is a good idea to search for a racket which is suitable to my style of game
When it is done  I need to determine the weight of the racket that I consider acceptable to play with without getting injured
There are different weights for adults  going from 250 to more than 340 grams  and children  going from 180 to 250 grams
When I selected the rackets which correspond to these parameters  I test them one after another until I find the racket that suits the best to me and which offers me the best feelings
The recommended period of test for one racket is one month
As a result  I switch the racket every month in order to optimize the quality of my choice
When I made my choice  I need to order one or several racket s  on the internet or go buy it in a shop

If I buy it them on the internet  there is a delay of 2 weeks before I receive it them  If I don t receive them in this period  I have to send an email to the customer service on the company s website
If I ordered it them on the internet  I have already paid at the moment of the purchase  If I went to the shop  I have to go pay at the cash desk
Once  I bought it them  I can go play with my new racket s  and be happy
The reservation can be done either on the internet or by telephone  depending on the club where we want to play
For example  to play in my tennis club  we have to go on a website and register in order to be able to reserve a court
The process begin when you decide to make a reservation
If we phone the clubhouse  an employee answers the telephone and asks you who you are
If you are a member of the club  the employee asks you to reserve online on the platform dedicated to the members of the club and your reservation is limited to two hours
If you are not  the employee gives you all the available hours and your reservation is limited to an hour
Once you have made your choice  the employee reserves the tennis court for you at the hour that you agreed and you will pay when you will arrive at the tennis club
During the week  early hours are cheaper than in the evening or the weekend
Prices go from 10 to 18
For the members  where are redirected to the website  they have to register on the website
When it is done  you receive the whole timetable for the week of the different tennis courts and all the reservations that are made and all the available hours
You have to make your choice and select the hour in the timetable section
Once you have chosen  you need to write all the names of the players and confirm the reservation
To complete the reservation  you need to choose the mean of payment   pay in cash at the club or directly on the website by debit or credit card
When the reservation is completed  an email is sent to all the members of the reservation
All employees in a supermarket have to be flexible
One possibility is to work as a cashier
When you are asked to go work as a cashier  you must stop what you are doing and tell your superior what you were doing and what you are going to do
Once you arrive at the desk  you have to switch with the previous employee by asking the employee to let you go at that desk
When the employee leaved  you can sit and enter your code and password on the computer in order to be identified
Once you are identified  you can start working
Your superior verifies is you apply some rules such as welcoming clients with a smile  work fast but not too fast and always adapt to the rhythm of the client and answer all his her questions
After you have scanned all the products  you have to ask which mean of payment the client choose and select it on the computer
If it is in cash  the client needs to put all the money in a machine that will count it and give back the difference between the money given and the real bill
For example  the machine will give back 20 euros if the bill was of 60 euros and the client gave 80 euros
If it is by card  you have to ask the client to put the card in a machine and let the payment occur
When the payment process is ended  you must ask the client if he she is interested in the actual gift given by instalment and if he she wants the receipt
If the client is interested  you give the gift and the receipt
Otherwise  you don t give them or ask if the next client is interested in having the gift
To end the process  you have to say a friendly goodbye to the client and wish him her a nice day
The process restart from scanning products at every client you will face during the tile of your work
Playing tennis can be seen as an easy sport but it is very technical
At first  you have to learn the good handhold
Once it is done  your footwork has to start when you see the opponent hits the ball
The first leg that needs to move is the leg that is on the same side of the hand in which your racket is
For example  if you are a left handed person  the first leg that will move is the left one
While you are moving to hit the ball  you must start your preparation of the forehand
Once you are close enough to the ball  you must take small steps to be more precise in your placement and optimize your position
While you are doing this  you must make the correct orientation of your shoulders depending on where you want to put the ball
Once your placement and your orientation are good  you can make the movement with your arm in order to hit the ball
The perfect hitting point is to hit the ball in front of you and at the height of your hip
Once you have hit the ball  you should make a step in the direction where the ball is going
Once the step is made  you should go back to the centre of the baseline and be ready for the next shot

The following process is about how to onboard people in our movement
First  a potential member fills a registration form on the website
The form is placed in a database
An email is sent to the responsible person
Those emails are actually quite annoying because there is often many responsible person
The responsible person contacts the potential member
The responsible person and the potential member set a date for an onboarding call
The potential member and the responsible person have an onboarding call
The responsible then assesses if the potential member is worth being recruted
If the potential member is worth being recruted  the responsible person ask the potential member to pay the membership fee
If the potential member is not worth being recruted  the responsible person inform the potential member and reject him in the database
once the responsible member has paid  the Secretary Generals confirm reception of the membership fee and confirm the member in the database
The Secretary Generals then inform the responsible person and the potential member   The process is ended
The program starts once a member has been confirmed by the Secretary Generals
The community lead informs the program manager that a new member needs to have a new buddy
The buddies are present in a database
The program manager contacts a buddy that they think is best for the new member
The buddy accepts the proposition and the program manager informs the new member
The buddy contacts the new member to fix a date
The buddy and the new member have a first buddy call
The buddy and the new member have a second buddy call
The buddy and the new member have a third buddy call
The buddy and the new member have a fourth buddy call
The process starts when a need for a roadtrip happens
The first step is to determine with whom I am going on a roadtrip
Then  we must determine when the people that want to come with me are available
This can be a problem as sometimes we can t find a date and it gets complicated
Once the date and the people are found  we need to determine where to go
For that  we will first determine what the personal budget of each person is
then  we will calculate the budget per day and look for a suitable destination
Sometimes  the differences in budget causes a lot of problems as some wants confort and other just don t want to spend too much for example
We then proceed to finding the best plane to go there and book the plane tickets
After that  we determine the itinary and book the places we want to stay at
We finally determine what s the average daily budget and the process is ended
The process starts when we feel like the person doesn t have feeling for their partner anymore
This can be due to several reason but the idea is that the feeling that we re speaking about is strong enough to start the process for example
The first thing will be to assess if the person has lost enough feeling to start the next phase
If it comes out that feelings are actually strong enough  then this person should analyse what caused the lost of feelings and the process ends
If it comes out that indeed  the person has lost feelings  then this person should analyse the context and how to announce it to their partner
The person should explain the process to their partner
Both of them will take a small break from each other to make the process less emotional
Both of them will then decide on a lodging solution
One or both of them should  depending of the outcome of the last step  move out
They could both mouve out of the first accomodation or only one of them leave it and the other stay un it
In the end each of the partner will announce the breakup to their family  friends
The process is finished

the graduate team member checks the application documents and determines If they are complete or not
if they are incomplete the process ends by sending a mail rejection to the applicant
if the application document are complete  The first interview will generally be a telephonic screening with the Graduate team
This is followed by a face to face interview or an Assessment Day with the service line you are applying for
As required The Final Stage could be a meeting with a Partner Director
For some roles we may require you to complete either psychometric or skills based tests depending on the role and Service line for example
when the personal interview has been conducted and the overall impression of the applicant
if we progress to the final stage of an employment offer  pre employment checks are conducted and if not  he receives an automated customized rejection
verbal offer will be made by the Graduate team  followed by a written contract

This is the process of management of emergency of the Veterinary Clinic of the University of Lige
Receipt of a call from the owner of the animal or the veterinarian in charge of the animal
Discussion  between the two parties to gather the following information  which race of animal  why and when will it suppose to arrive at the clinic
An intern writes the information  on a board in the emergency room
The animal arrives at the clinic
The owner checks in at the reception
The owner pays a deposit either by cash or by card
The secretary reports the arrival of the animal to the emergency interns
For example  Jim  a cat  arrived with an eye problem
Students come to take the animal s background story
The animal is taken care of by a veterinarian for a first check up
The results of the first check up are communicated to the owners

Should the veterinarian considers it relevant  he asks permission to extentd the work with additional examinations  If he does not  consider it relevant   he returns the animal with treatment  if necessary
The results of additional examinations are communicated to the owner if they are already available  or he explains that he will communicate them as soon as they arrive
If the veterinarian considers it necessary  he asks that the animal remains in hospitalization  If he does not  he returns the animal with treatment  if necessary
The owner will sign an hospitalization contract at the reception
The owner pays an additional deposit if necessary
The animal is brought to the hospitalization block
The owner leaves the clinic
This is the process of management of consultation of the Veterinary Clinic of the University of Lige
The owner calls the clinic to schedule an appointment or goes to the reception to make it
The reception secretary encodes the appointment on a computer in the rlevant system
The secretary explains the modalities to follow for the appointment
For example  your dog should be fasting as from midnight on the day of the appointment
The owner comes to the clinic on the day of his appointment with his animal
The owner checks in at the reception
The reception secretary informs the veterinarian  who must do the consultation  that his appointment is there
The owner will wait in the waiting room
The veterinarian comes to pick up the animal and its owner
They both go to a consultation room
The veterinarian performs the exams that were scheduled
For example  he performs a scanner or he simply osculates the animal
The veterinarian gives the results of the examination if they are diectly available  or does explain that he will communicate them as soon as they will be available
If the veterinarian considers it necessary  he requests  that the animal has to remain in hospitalization  If he does not  he is returning the animal with  the treatment  when applicable
The owner goes to the reception to pay the price of his consultation
The owner pays the cost of the consultation either by cash or by card
The owner leaves the clinic
This is the process of management of release of animals from the Veterinary Clinic of the University of Lige
The animal is in hospitalization
The vet does his daily round and examines the animal that is in hospitalization
The veterinarian calls the owners of the animal to inform them that they can come and pick it up
Together  they make an appointment for the release
The owner comes to the clinic
The owner goes to the reception
The reception secretary signals to the veterinarian  in charge of the outing  that his appointment is there
The veterinarian prepares the discharge instructions  as well as the drugs if they are necessary
The veterinarian  go to meet the owner
Together  they go to a consultation room
The veterinarian explains the different information that was taken from the examinations and the procedures for the animal s release
A student brings the animal to the consultation room
The owner and the animal leave the clinic

Although some people think it s very hard  the recipe for chocolate chip cookies is actually a very easy recipe
The process starts when you prepare all the ingredients and equipments for this recipe
While the oven is preheating  you first combinethe dry ingredients  the flour the baking powder   baking soda and salt in a bowl
Then in another bowl  you cream together the butter and sugar
Add and beat the eggs and vanilla to combine
Add your dry ingredients in your mixture
Then  stir until just combined
Next  add and mix your chocolate chips with the mixture until it is well distributed
You can use as much chocolate chips as you want
Once the cookie dough is finished  portion and roll the dough by using a cookie scoop
In this step  you have two options You can either bake your dough or freeze it
If you want to bake the cookies  you check if your oven is ready
then you place the cookies evenly apart on a baking sheet
Then you bake them for 10 minutes
When the time is done  you remove the cookies from the oven and the process ends
If you want to freeze your cookies  you space them up in a parchment lined baking sheet
Then  put the the baking sheet in the freezer for 30 minutes
Once the dough is slightly frozen  transfer the cookie dough balls to an airtight container
Then  freeze for up to 2 months and your process ends here

The sorting center receives the raw materials
The employees recover only plastic parts
For example  labels or metal parts are discarded
The workers  separate the plastics according to their color
The selected plastic parts are then sent to the regenerating factory
Each color category is seprately crushed and shredded
The plastics are then introduced into industrial washers
The plastic parts go through drying centrifuges
The materials are then mixed by machines until the material is homogeneous
The heating walls of this same machine form a uniform paste while color is also aded
The paste is then filtered out of the machine
The paste is analyzed by the quality control department
The portions that didn t pass the check are returned  to be re filtered again
The portions that pass this check are stored and the recycling process end up here

Grains are transformed from their harvested form into a cracked form
Specific enzymes are isolated
Then  cracked grains are steeped in hot water
The water used in the process collects the released sugar and is drained from the grains
At this point  the sweet  yet stocky liquid is referred to as the wort
The next step involves the boiling of the collected wort
The boiling process lasts an hour
As the wort continues to boil  spikes and hops are added into it on several occasions
Once the hour has come to pass  the wort is removed from the boiler and cooling
Once it is cooled  it is also strained and filtered
The next step is to pass the strained and filtered wort through fermenting vessels
Then  the beer is bottled and is kept in the right temperature so that it matures
When the maturation stage is done  the bottle can be sold  and the process is finished

A pizza is a dish of Italian origin  a flat round base of dough baked with a topping of tomatoes and cheese  typically with added meat  fish  or vegetables
The process starts when the cooker combine flour and salt in a large bowl
Then  the cooker add the olive oil  lukewarm water and bloomed yeast mixture
By using a spoon  the cooker mix until a shaggy dough begins to form
The cooker turn the dough onto a clean work surface  cover with a plastic wrap  and let it rise for 10 15 minutes
Often  a pizza dough is not rising because of dead yeast It can be a result of too hot water
Meanwhile  the cooker make the tomato sauce
Once the dough has rested  the cooker takes a portion and presses the dough into a thin round and makes it thinner
The cooker adds the sauce and ingredients
The cooker slides the pizza onto the preheated pizza stone  and bakes it for 15minutes

To buy a train ticket  the customer can go to a train station or order online to save time for example
The process starts when a customer go to a train station
The train station employees are notified that a customer want to buy a ticket
An employee asks for which destination the customer want a ticket
The farther the destination is  the higher the price ticket will be
The customer communicates his order to the employee
The employee asks if it is a round trip
The customer answer the employee
The customer pays cash or pays by card
Finally  the employee give the ticket to the customer
